A wheellock, wheel-lock or wheel lock, is a friction-wheel mechanism to cause a 
spark for firing a firearm. It was the next major development in firearms 
technology after the matchlock and the first self-igniting firearm. Its name is from 
its rotating steel wheel to provide ignition. ... Developed around 1500, it was used 
alongside the matchlock and was later...
